B.10.5 
Skin and soft 
tissue injuries 
Wound infections are often 
polymicrobial.  
Bacterial: 
Aerobic bacteria  
Staphylococcus aureus 
Escherichia coli 
 Pseudomonas aeruginosa 
Enterobacter cloacae 
Klebsiella spp. 
Streptococcus spp. 
Enterococcus spp.  
Proteus spp. 
 
Anaerobic bacteria 
Peptostreptococcus spp. 
Prevotella spp.  
Porphyromonas spp.  
Bacteroides spp. 
Maillard JY, Kampf G, Cooper R. Antimicrobial 
stewardship of antiseptics that are pertinent to 
wounds: the need for a united approach. JAC 
Antimicrob Resist. 2021 Mar 25;3(1):dlab027.
